skill.name: benchling-integration
skill.description: Benchling R&D platform integration. Access registry (DNA, proteins), inventory, ELN entries, workflows via API, build Benchling Apps, query Data Warehouse, for lab data management automation.
skill.summary: Benchling R&D platform integration. Access registry (DNA, proteins), inventory, ELN entries, workflo...
skill.author: davila7

security_audit.summary: Documentation-only skill containing no executable code. This is a pure reference guide for Benchling API/SDK usage with no file access, network calls, or command execution capabilities.

content.user_title: Connect to Benchling for lab data
content.value_statement: Managing laboratory data across Benchling requires learning multiple API patterns. This skill provides ready-to-use examples for DNA sequences, inventory, and electronic lab notebooks so you can focus on science instead of debugging API calls.
actual_capabilities: Authenticate to Benchling using API keys or OAuth credentials
Create, read, update, and archive DNA, RNA, and protein sequences
Manage laboratory inventory including containers, boxes, and locations
Create and link electronic lab notebook entries
Execute workflow tasks and track progress programmatically
Query Benchling Data Warehouse for analytics and reporting
limitations: Requires active Benchling account and API access enabled
Does not replace Benchling UI for complex data visualization
Cannot modify tenant-level settings or user permissions
Rate limits apply based on your Benchling plan tier

use_cases.title: Import plasmid collections
use_cases.description: Bulk import DNA sequences from FASTA files into Benchling registry for tracking.

use_cases.title: Track sample inventory
use_cases.description: Monitor container locations, volumes, and check-in/check-out status automatically.

use_cases.title: Link analysis to experiments
use_cases.description: Create notebook entries with sequence references and export data for downstream analysis.

prompt_templates.title: List DNA sequences
prompt_templates.prompt: List all DNA sequences in folder 'fld_abc123' using the Benchling SDK.

prompt_templates.title: Create notebook entry
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a new electronic lab notebook entry for a PCR experiment in folder 'experiments'.

prompt_templates.title: Update container location
prompt_templates.prompt: Transfer container 'cont_abc123' from Box A to Box B in the Benchling inventory.

prompt_templates.title: Bulk import sequences
prompt_templates.prompt: Import 50 DNA sequences from 'sequences.csv' into the Benchling registry with custom fields.

output_examples.input: List all DNA sequences in the registry

best_practices: Store API keys in environment variables and never commit credentials to version control
Use pagination with generators to handle large result sets efficiently
Apply least privilege principles when creating service accounts for automation
anti_patterns: Hardcoding API keys directly in scripts or configuration files
Loading all entities into memory before filtering when server-side filters exist
Ignoring rate limit responses instead of implementing exponential backoff

faq.question: Does this skill work with self-hosted Benchling?
faq.answer: Yes. Provide your tenant URL during authentication. Works with both cloud and self-hosted deployments.

faq.question: What Python version is required?
faq.answer: Python 3.7 or higher is required for the Benchling SDK. Newer SDK versions may require Python 3.9+.

faq.question: Can I use this offline?
faq.answer: No. The skill requires network access to communicate with your Benchling tenant API endpoints.

faq.question: How are credentials secured?
faq.answer: The skill documents credential handling. You must store API keys in environment variables using os.environ or .env files.

faq.question: What happens on rate limit errors?
faq.answer: The SDK automatically retries with exponential backoff. You can customize retry behavior using RetryStrategy configuration.

faq.question: How does this compare to Benchling Apps?
faq.answer: This skill provides programmatic API access similar to Benchling Apps but runs externally. Apps have tighter integration but require Benchling hosting.
